```{r, include = FALSE, message = FALSE}
## Install packages if not already installed
if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))
    install.packages("BiocManager")

BiocManager::install("ggtree")
install.packages("ape")

```

1. Load libraries and set working directory:

```{r, setup, include = FALSE}
## Load libraries and set global working directory
library(ggplot2)
library(ggtree)
library(ape)

knitr::opts_knit$set(root.dir = '/home/inak/bbs_project/data/phylogenetic_tree/')
```

2. Load input data

```{r, include = FALSE}
# Assuming your Newick tree is stored in a file named "tree.newick"
bbs1_data <- read.tree("BBS1_tree.txt")
bbs2_data <- read.tree("BBS2_tree.txt")
bbs4_data <- read.tree("BBS4_tree.txt")
bbs5_data <- read.tree("BBS5_tree.txt")
bbs7_data <- read.tree("BBS7_tree.txt")
bbs8_data <- read.tree("BBS8_tree.txt")
bbs9_data <- read.tree("BBS9_tree.txt")
bbs12_data <- read.tree("BBS12_tree.txt")

# Create the plot
bbs1_tree <- ggtree(bbs1_data) + 
    geom_tiplab() +  # Add labels to the tips
    theme_tree2() +
   ggtitle("BBS1")   # Use a theme suitable for trees

bbs2_tree <- ggtree(bbs2_data) + 
    geom_tiplab() +  # Add labels to the tips
    theme_tree2() +
   ggtitle("BBS2")   # Use a theme suitable for trees

bbs4_tree <- ggtree(bbs4_data) + 
    geom_tiplab() +  # Add labels to the tips
    theme_tree2() +
   ggtitle("BBS4")   # Use a theme suitable for trees

bbs5_tree <- ggtree(bbs5_data) + 
    geom_tiplab() +  # Add labels to the tips
    theme_tree2() +
   ggtitle("BBS5")   # Use a theme suitable for trees

bbs7_tree <- ggtree(bbs7_data) + 
    geom_tiplab() +  # Add labels to the tips
    theme_tree2() +
   ggtitle("BBS7")   # Use a theme suitable for trees

bbs8_tree <- ggtree(bbs8_data) + 
    geom_tiplab() +  # Add labels to the tips
    theme_tree2() +
   ggtitle("BBS8")   # Use a theme suitable for trees

bbs9_tree <- ggtree(bbs9_data) + 
    geom_tiplab() +  # Add labels to the tips
    theme_tree2() +
   ggtitle("BBS9")   # Use a theme suitable for trees

bbs12_tree <- ggtree(bbs12_data) + 
    geom_tiplab() +  # Add labels to the tips
    theme_tree2() +
   ggtitle("BBS12")   # Use a theme suitable for trees

(combined_plot <- ggarrange(bbs1_tree, bbs2_tree, bbs4_tree,
                            bbs5_tree, bbs7_tree, bbs8_tree,
                            bbs9_tree, bbs12_tree,
                            ncol = 2,
                            nrow = 4))


```
